column5: Has anyone been on the Clova Road recently? Our group heads up there Saturday, June 12 and we were wondering what to expect. Also...any bug reports for that area of Quebec? Fishing reports? Thanks.

The only time I was on Clova road it was very bad.We had to slow to about 25mph.The bugs should be at their peak in mid June.Take coils for the cabin and you will be alright.They wont be too bad when you are on the water. Good Fishing Pikeman

Be especially wary after a heavy rainstorm - I haven't been on this road in a few years but I still don't think it is graded every day and after a storm it's like driving on speedbumps the entire way.

I thought you didn't have to travel the old clova road. Thought the new road went to Parent from Mont-Laurier and then from there it was a about a 55 minute ride to clova on a well kept gravel road. http://www.caesars-northcamps.com/wa...camps-eng.html
For a bug report around Clova - see http://www.theweathernetwork.com/bugreport/caqc0118
This is one of the most interesting thread reports I have ever seen! Thanks retire55 and I'll be using it regularly.
It appears as though the situation is normal on the Clova Road. Thanks for replies.
